intro: Trichilia catigua, commonly known as the "Brazilian rosewood," is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark wood and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by elongated, woody pods containing flat, elliptical seeds. Trichilia catigua is also valued for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for numerous wildlife species.
